request_process.step_1: Identify the specific agency that maintains the records
request_process.step_2: Submit written or verbal request to agency custodian
request_process.step_3: Agency must respond within 3 business days
request_process.step_4: If denied, agency must provide written explanation with legal citation
request_process.step_5: Appeals go to district court, not administrative appeal
request_process.step_6: Contact Kansas Attorney General for violation complaints

fees.copying: Actual cost only (machine operation, paper, supplies)
fees.electronic_records: May include programming and computer time costs
fees.search_time: Actual cost of staff time if charged

exemptions_summary: Records specifically prohibited by federal or state law
Personnel records and personal privacy information
Trade secrets and confidential business information

basic_request.subject: Kansas Open Records Act Request
basic_request.body:
Pursuant to the Kansas Open Records Act (K.S.A. 45-215 et seq.), I hereby request access to and copies of the following public records:

[Describe records with specificity]

Per K.S.A. 45-218(d), please provide a response within three (3) business days of receipt of this request. If access is denied, please provide a written statement citing the specific provision of law under which access is denied.

Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request or to discuss fees for copying.

Thank you for your assistance.

appeal_request.note: Kansas does not have administrative appeals. Appeals must be filed in district court pursuant to K.S.A. 45-222.
appeal_request.process: File petition in district court to compel disclosure, with burden on agency to prove exemption applies.

complaint_to_ag.subject: Complaint Regarding KORA Violation
complaint_to_ag.body: I am filing this complaint regarding a violation of the Kansas Open Records Act by [Agency Name]. On [Date], I submitted a records request for [Description]. The agency [describe violation - failed to respond timely, wrongfully denied access, etc.]. I believe this violates K.S.A. 45-218 and request investigation and appropriate enforcement action.
